def: a son of one's brother or sister, or of one's brother-in-law or sister-in-law.
a daughter of one's brother or sister, or of one's brother-in-law or sister-in-law.
a yellowish- or brownish-green edible fruit that is typically narrow at the stalk and wider toward the base, with sweet, slightly gritty flesh.
an instance of complete destruction.
of or concerning the part of the mind of which one is not fully aware but which influences one's actions and feelings.
extremely large.
too long, slow, or dull; tiresome or monotonous.
a natural desire to satisfy a bodily need, especially for food.
maintain (something) in its original or existing state.
prevention of wasteful use of a resource.
love, loyalty, or enthusiasm for a person, activity, or cause.
acquire (something) by paying for it; buy.
pursue in order to catch or catch up with.
follow (someone or something) in order to catch or attack them.
the action of following or pursuing someone or something.
cause (someone) to do something through reasoning or argument.
re-examine and make alterations to (written or printed matter).
the ability to understand something immediately, without the need for conscious reasoning.
a small rectangular block typically made of fired or sun-dried clay, used in building.
a mixture of lime with cement, sand, and water, used in building to bond bricks or stones.
causing disappointment at the end of an exciting or impressive series of events.
tentative, unsure, or slow in acting or speaking.
willfully causing pain or suffering to others, or feeling no concern about it.
savagely fierce, cruel, or violent.
the state or quality of being ferocious.
a persistent feeling of ill will or resentment resulting from a past insult or injury.
say something in a boastful manner.
travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis.
regard as probable; expect or predict.
wheat or any other cultivated cereal crop used as food.
rough or loose in texture or grain.
the route or direction followed by a ship, aircraft, road, or river.
prod (someone) gently, typically with one's elbow, in order to draw their attention to something.
run or travel somewhere in a great hurry.
the manner in which a person behaves, especially on a particular occasion or in a particular context.
conforming with generally accepted standards of respectable or moral behavior.
dedicated or consecrated to God or a religious purpose; sacred.
a disagreement, argument, or debate.
a conclusion reached on the basis of evidence and reasoning.
a change which is a result or consequence of an action or other cause.
a limitation or restriction.
without doubt (used for emphasis).
undoubtedly; definitely; surely.
the speed of something in a given direction.
produce and discharge (something, especially gas or radiation).
intended to be kept secret.
not connected with or relevant to something.
encouragement of something to make it develop or become more active.
a document given to a person saying that they do not have a job any more
seize and take legal custody of (something, especially a vehicle, goods, or documents) because of an infringement of a law or regulation.
not taut or held tightly in position; loose.
feel intense dislike or disgust for.
a sudden, dramatic, and important discovery or development.
jump or spring a long way, to a great height, or with great force.
create or design (something that has not existed before); be the originator of.
make (something needed or wanted) available to someone; provide.
a thing that completes or brings to perfection.
combining in such a way as to enhance or emphasize the qualities of each other or another.
a polite expression of praise or admiration.
move about or travel aimlessly or unsystematically, especially over a wide area.
roughly force (something) into place.
(especially of a muscle or someone's body) stretched tight or rigid.
estimate (something) to be smaller or less important than it actually is.
estimate (something) to be better, larger, or more important than it really is.
recognize the full worth of.
excessively proud of oneself; vain.

tr: asal, ilk, en baş, en önemli

def: belonging to the very distant past and no longer in existence.
having a pleasant or sweet smell.
form an idea of the amount, number, or value of; assess.
declare (someone) to be guilty of a criminal offense by the verdict of a jury or the decision of a judge in a court of law.
happening or doing something at the agreed or proper time; on time.
speak to or treat with disrespect or scornful abuse.
an agreement or a settlement of a dispute that is reached by each side making concessions.
a comparison between two things, typically for the purpose of explanation or clarification.
buy or obtain (an asset or object) for oneself.
(of a person) clever, original, and inventive.
(of items or people gathered or considered together) of various types or from different sources.
the consequences or aftereffects of a significant unpleasant event.
put forward (an idea or plan) for consideration or discussion by others.
propose or formally enter as a candidate for election or for an honor or award.
the action of nominating or state of being nominated.
relating to or acting as a cause.
obstruct (someone or something) so as to prevent them from continuing to a destination.
match or surpass (a person or achievement), typically by imitation.
playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing and amusing way.
a person or thing that is excluded from a general statement or does not follow a rule.
unusual; not typical.
represent (something) as being larger, better, or worse than it really is.
the arrival of a notable person, thing, or event.
agreement or harmony between people or groups.
of considerable importance, size, or worth.
having the power to make laws.
identify the nature of (an illness or other problem) by examination of the symptoms.
forbidding or uninviting.
strive to gain or win something by defeating or establishing superiority over others who are trying to do the same.
not having or showing the necessary skills to do something successfully.
critical observation or examination.
confirm or support (something which has been questioned).
come between so as to prevent or alter a result or course of events.
having or displaying a passionate intensity.
the act of setting someone free from imprisonment, slavery, or oppression; release.
based on, concerned with, or verifiable by observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
a collection of things or quantity of material tied or wrapped up together.
predict (the future or a future event).
acting with or showing care and thought for the future.
prove more powerful than opposing forces; be victorious.
a minor change or addition designed to improve a text, piece of legislation, etc.
strong and healthy; vigorous.
(of food) belonging to the category that is salty or spicy rather than sweet.
stick fast to (a surface or substance).
about to happen.
serving as a desirable model; representing the best of its kind.
absolutely necessary or important; essential.
notably large in size, amount, or extent.
(of a person, animal, or other living organism) grow or develop in a healthy or vigorous way, especially as the result of a particularly favorable environment.
a rule or directive made and maintained by an authority.
a set of reasons or a logical basis for a course of action or a particular belief.
of, from, or like God or a god.
in a literal manner or sense; exactly.
bring or come to an end.
death.
covering or affecting a large area.
a person who is present at an event or incident but does not take part.
(of a country or region) having the freedom to govern itself or control its own affairs.
an event or occurrence.
an ugly, twisted expression on a person's face, typically expressing disgust, pain, or wry amusement.
drink (something) by taking small mouthfuls.
first in order of importance; main.
the expression of approval or agreement.
(of a structure) fall down or in; give way.
deduce or conclude (information) from evidence and reasoning rather than from explicit statements.
lacking restraint in spending money or using resources.
the action or fact of accepting or yielding to a superior force or to the will or authority of another person.
arrive at (a fact or a conclusion) by reasoning; draw as a logical conclusion.
force (something unwelcome or unfamiliar) to be accepted or put in place.
look fixedly or vacantly at someone or something with one's eyes wide open.
a set of steps leading from one floor of a building to another, typically inside the building.
break, split, or burst (something).
struggle or stagger helplessly or clumsily in water or mud.
a unit of pronunciation having one vowel sound, with or without surrounding consonants, forming the whole or a part of a word; e.g., there are two syllables in water and three in inferno.
(of time) pass or go by.
legally take (another's child) and bring it up as one's own.
the state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location).
declare one's public approval or support of.
the ability to see, hear, or become aware of something through the senses.
close or do up securely.
deliberately destroy, damage, or obstruct (something), especially for political or military advantage.
the criminal act of deliberately setting fire to property.
bring (goods or services) into a country from abroad for sale.
having or showing a confident and forceful personality.
accept or act in accordance with (a rule, decision, or recommendation).
use (something) to bad effect or for a bad purpose; misuse.
(of something bad or undesirable) very great; intense.
cause (pain, distress, or difficulty) to become less severe or serious.
a distinctive smell, especially one that is pleasant.
cover or enclose (someone or something) in paper or soft material.
the action or process of receiving something sent, given, or inflicted.

the continued possession, use, or control of something.
desire or be curious to know something.
having a good basic knowledge of arithmetic; able to understand and work with numbers.
an expression designed to call something to mind without mentioning it explicitly; an indirect or passing reference.
the exchange of a commodity for money; the action of selling something.
approach or enter (a place).
a set of two things used together or regarded as a unit.
a portion of an object or of material, produced by cutting, tearing, or breaking the whole.
closely acquainted; familiar, close.
free from pretense or deceit; proceeding from genuine feelings.
not having arrived, happened, or been done by the expected time.
the side of a person's or animal's body between the ribs and the hip.
a long, thin, flat piece of timber, used especially in building and flooring.
move or cause to move in a particular direction by turning over and over on an axis.
an advertisement.
play a keyboard or plucked stringed instrument, especially in an inexpressive or unskilled way.

morally corrupt; wicked.
lacking physical strength, especially as a result of age or illness.
a job or profession.
lose consciousness for a short time because of a temporarily insufficient supply of oxygen to the brain.
a flat, shallow container with a raised rim, typically used for carrying food and drink, or for holding small items.
deliberately cruel or violent.
the action, treated as a criminal offense, of demanding payment or another benefit from someone in return for not revealing compromising or damaging information about them.
give (someone) something, typically money, in recognition of loss, suffering, or injury incurred; recompense.
a remarkable concurrence of events or circumstances without apparent causal connection.
the fact of two or more events or circumstances happening or existing at the same time.
worthy of attention; striking.
making sure of avoiding potential danger, mishap, or harm; cautious.
respond to (a gesture or action) by making a corresponding one.
hesitating or doubting.

need for a particular purpose.
severe suffering or privation.
let air or gas out of (a tire, balloon, or similar object).
take action in order to prevent (an anticipated event) from happening; forestall.
an organization set up to provide help and raise money for those in need.
look quickly, typically in a furtive manner.
a person who has been rejected by society or a social group.
a person who has broken the law, especially one who remains at large or is a fugitive.
the quality of being thankful; readiness to show appreciation for and to return kindness.

cause to feel extreme fear.

giving rise or likely to give rise to public disagreement.
lower in rank, status, or quality.

the circumstances that form the setting for an event, statement, or idea, and in terms of which it can be fully understood and assessed.

based on or in accordance with reason or logic.
causing embarrassment.
forbidden by law, rules, or custom.
marked by exactness and accuracy of expression or detail.

well known from long or close association.

a beginning or start.
the point or place where something begins, arises, or is derived.

successfully bring about or reach (a desired objective, level, or result) by effort, skill, or courage.
a set of circumstances in which one finds oneself; a state of affairs.
having or showing zeal.
an idea or opinion produced by thinking, or occurring suddenly in the mind.
of, from, in, or characteristic of a country or language other than one's own.
(of a statement or course of action) chosen in accordance with wisdom or prudence; likely to be of benefit.
a collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place, institution, or group of people.
fail to fulfill the hopes or expectations of (someone).
not quite; very nearly.
establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed, suspected, or feared to be the case).
take or carry (people or goods) from one place to another by means of a vehicle, aircraft, or ship.
a short introduction to a book, typically by a person other than the author.
the necessary items for a particular purpose.
the way in which a word is pronounced.
the soft substance consisting of muscle and fat that is found between the skin and bones of an animal or a human.
(especially of clothes or furnishings) providing physical ease and relaxation.
the action of receiving something or the fact of its being received.
a set of instructions for preparing a particular dish, including a list of the ingredients required.
a light shoe with either an openwork upper or straps attaching the sole to the foot.
free from outside control; not depending on another's authority.
the fact or state of being independent.
feeling or showing an appreciation of kindness; thankful.

suggesting something supernatural; uncanny.

free time.
